text: Answer: (b) Solution: S1 False: TCP uses cumulative ACKs, where each ACK says it’s received all bytes up to the sequence number X - 1. Packet #5 could have been received even though #4 has not. S2 True: TCP uses cumulative ACKs, where each ACK says it’s received all bytes up to the sequence number X - 1. So, if A received ACK 401 that means bytes 1 to 400 has be received successfully.
